settings.helpText: Main heading of the text block
Sub heading of the text block
Content of the text block
Name of the block in Contentful.
Controls whether the component is shown as a single image, the first of the group, or a carousel of images.
Group of images that the main image belongs to.
Width of the slides of the carousel in vw unit. Default value is 80 vw.
Number of slides per view in the carousel. Default value is 1. CAUTION: Choose slidesWidth accordingly. Don't f*ck up my beautiful component.
Controls the fit of the carousel slides.
Name of the Image component in Contentful.
List of relevant project information.
The label of the label-value pair.
The value of part of the label-value pair. Must stay rather short.
Main heading of the hero section. Will probably be displayed bigger than other stuff.
Sub heading of the hero section.
Text content of the hero section. Use if needed.
Main image of the hero section. Will be displayed under the title if no custom display. Optional.
Background image of the hero section. Will be displayed behind the title with a black overlay on top. Optional.
All the images needed for a header section.
Controls the component that will be used for the hero section. If none chose, it will be the basic one.
Title of the project. Be specific and interesting.
The name of the client (or company) for which I did the work.
Description of the project. Summarize it in one line or two.
Page of the project defined by the project card.
Tags related to this project.
Heading of the callout. Usually "situation" or "design goal".
Text of the callout. Feel free to use titles as well.
Image of the callout. Usually a lightbulb.
The author of the testimonial, a satisfied client.
The great review's text content.
Profile picture of the happy client or logo of their company.
The title to be displayed.
Title of the small duplex section. Optional.
Component at the left of the duplex. Will be on top on small screen sizes.
Component at the right of the duplex. Will be at the bottom on small screen sizes.
Will be the name of the tab of the page (in <head>).
Slug part of the URL for the page.
Content of the page in order.
Main color as a hexadecimal code.
Pages that will be accessible through the menu. Their title will be the text of the link.
Name of the menu (Navbar, Footer, Product...). Not displayed in the website.
Name of the tag as it will be displayed on the website.
ID if the tag, used in the code (for filtering hopefully).
HEX code of the color of the tag.
Text displayed above the projects group. Optional.
Project cards to display.

heading.en: About the company and the product
heading.fr: √Ä propos de l'entreprise et du produit

content.value: APRIL is an international insurance company operating as a
Managing General Agent (MGA)

, bridging insurance companies and brokers. It serves individuals and businesses with various insurance lines like car and property insurance. In response to industry digitalization, APRIL launched its online platform, APRIL ON, in 2020.

APRIL ON is a
Business-to-Business (B2B) web application
designed for
insurance brokers
and their firms to
purchase insurance products
on behalf of their clients. It aims to simplify insurance, reflecting the company's dedication to leveraging technology for streamlined processes.
APRIL est une compagnie d'assurance internationale op√©rant comme un
Agent G√©n√©ral de Gestion (MGA)

, faisant le lien entre les compagnies d'assurance et les courtiers. Elle sert les particuliers et les entreprises avec diverses lignes d'assurance comme l'assurance automobile et habitation. En r√©ponse √† la digitalisation de l'industrie, APRIL a lanc√© sa plateforme en ligne, APRIL ON, en 2020.
APRIL ON est une
application web Business-to-Business (B2B)
con√ßue pour les
courtiers en assurance
et leurs cabinets pour
acheter des produits d'assurance
au nom de leurs clients. Elle vise √† simplifier l'assurance, refl√©tant l'engagement de l'entreprise √† tirer parti de la technologie pour des processus plus fluides.

internalName.en: About the company and the product

content.value: APRIL On is the primary platform through which users purchase APRIL‚Äôs insurance products. However, they reported encountering difficulties in understanding the status of their files and the whole underlying process, to the point where they sometimes needed a document to help them interpret the situation. This lack of clarity frequently leads to delays, particularly when users are uncertain about the next steps or their required actions.

APRIL ON est la plateforme principale par laquelle les utilisateurs ach√®tent les produits d'assurance d'APRIL. Cependant, ils ont signal√© rencontrer des difficult√©s √† comprendre le statut de leurs dossiers et l'ensemble du processus sous-jacent, au point o√π ils ont parfois besoin d'un document pour les aider √† interpr√©ter la situation. Ce manque de clart√© entra√Æne fr√©quemment des retards, notamment lorsque les utilisateurs ne sont pas certains des prochaines √©tapes ou des actions requises.

The jobs of insurance brokers can be stressful. They are tasked with juggling various responsibilities, like managing client relationships, researching insurance products, and negotiating deals. Additionally, they frequently use multiple online platforms like APRIL ON from different insurance providers to buy products for clients. Therefore, these platforms must be user-friendly, efficient, and comprehensive to meet brokers' needs effectively.

Les t√¢ches des courtiers en assurance peuvent √™tre stressantes. Ils sont charg√©s de jongler avec diverses responsabilit√©s, telles que la gestion des relations clients, la recherche de produits d'assurance et la n√©gociation de contrats. De plus, ils utilisent fr√©quemment plusieurs plateformes en ligne comme APRIL ON de diff√©rents fournisseurs d'assurance pour acheter des produits pour leurs clients. Par cons√©quent, ces plateformes doivent √™tre conviviales, efficaces et compl√®tes pour r√©pondre efficacement aux besoins des courtiers.
The status system is present in most of the part of the app
where the user works on the files they already created
. We identified that most of the confusion occurs on the
Quote list screen
and on the
Quote details screen
. The latter one is central in the process, as it is the where the user will be able to do all the actions that move their file forward.
Le syst√®me de statut est pr√©sent dans la plupart des parties de l'application
o√π l'utilisateur travaille sur les fichiers qu'il a d√©j√† cr√©√©s
. Nous avons identifi√© que la plupart de la confusion se produit sur l'√©cran de
Liste des soumissions
et sur l'√©cran de
D√©tails des soumissions
. Ce dernier est central dans le processus, car c'est l√† que l'utilisateur pourra effectuer toutes les actions qui font avancer son dossier.

heading.en: Unclear labels for statuses and actions

content.value: Some status labels don't match the corresponding actions.
For instance, transitioning from "Not sent" to "Sent" requires actions like Edit and Confirm, rather than Send. Certain statuses like "Sent" lack clear guidance on the next steps or actions required.
Certain statuses like "Sent" lack clear guidance on the next steps or actions required.
Statuses primarily indicate past actions
rather than guiding users towards the next steps in the process.
The choice of
colors for statuses lacks consistency and meaningful differentiation
, which may add confusion.
Action buttons lack uniformity
across the application, leading to inconsistency in user interactions.

During the research phase, we gathered valuable insights from various sources. Feedback from business developers provided qualitative inputs, while data on delays and drop-off rates offered quantitative insights into user behavior. These inputs led to significant outcomes.

We identified issues such as unclear labels and confusion with actions, a lack of guidance on the quote details screen, and difficulty in identifying files needing attention on the list screen. These findings guided our efforts to address user experience challenges comprehensively.

Pendant la phase de recherche, nous avons recueilli des informations pr√©cieuses de diverses sources. Les retours des d√©veloppeurs commerciaux ont fourni des informations qualitatives, tandis que les donn√©es sur les retards et les taux d'abandon ont offert des informations quantitatives sur le comportement des utilisateurs. Ces contributions ont conduit √† des r√©sultats significatifs.

Nous avons identifi√© des probl√®mes tels que des √©tiquettes peu claires et une confusion avec les actions, un manque de guidance sur l'√©cran de d√©tails des devis, et une difficult√© √† identifier les fichiers n√©cessitant une attention sur l'√©cran de liste. Ces constats ont orient√© nos efforts pour aborder les d√©fis de l'exp√©rience utilisateur de mani√®re exhaustive.

heading.en: Unclear labels for statuses and actions
heading.fr: √âtiquettes peu claires pour les statuts et les actions

content.value: Some status labels don't match the corresponding actions. For instance, transitioning from "Not sent" to "Sent" requires actions like Edit and Confirm, rather than Send. Certain statuses like "Sent" lack clear guidance on the next steps or actions required.
Certain statuses like "Sent" lack clear guidance on the next steps or actions required.
Statuses primarily indicate past actions rather than guiding users towards the next steps in the process.
The choice of colors for statuses lacks consistency and meaningful differentiation, which may add confusion.
Action buttons lack uniformity across the application, leading to inconsistency in user interactions.

Certaines √©tiquettes de statut ne correspondent pas aux actions correspondantes. Par exemple, passer de "Non envoy√©" √† "Envoy√©" n√©cessite des actions comme Modifier et Confirmer, plut√¥t qu'Envoyer.
Certains statuts comme "Envoy√©" manquent de guidance claire sur les prochaines √©tapes ou actions requises.
Les statuts indiquent principalement les actions pass√©es plut√¥t que de guider les utilisateurs vers les prochaines √©tapes du processus.
Le choix des couleurs pour les statuts manque de coh√©rence et de diff√©renciation significative, ce qui peut ajouter √† la confusion.
Les boutons d'action manquent d'uniformit√© dans l'application, conduisant √† une inconsistance dans les interactions utilisateur.

internalName.en: Unclear labels for statuses and actions

heading.en: Lack of guidance on quote details
heading.fr: Manque d'orientation sur les d√©tails du devis

content.value: General lack of guidance towards the next action:
A lack of button hierarchy makes it challenging to identify the primary action clearly
The absence of past status history or a preview of next steps fails to provide an overview of the entire process
Grouping document download and upload buttons with the recap section is not logical as they serve different functions and relate to distinct topics
The grey area wastes space and lacks aesthetic appeal
Manque g√©n√©ral d'indications de la prochaine action :
Un manque de hi√©rarchie des boutons rend difficile l'identification claire de l'action principale
L'absence d'historique des statuts pr√©c√©dents ou d'aper√ßu des prochaines √©tapes ne fournit pas une vue d'ensemble du processus

Regrouper les boutons de t√©l√©chargement et de t√©l√©versement de documents avec la section r√©capitulative n'est pas logique car ils servent des fonctions diff√©rentes et se rapportent √† des sujets distincts
La zone grise gaspille de l'espace et manque d'attrait esth√©tique
